December 3, 1995: Fiction
FIVE DAYS IN PARIS, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $15.95.) A chance encounter
between two Americans at the Ritz changes their lives forever.
THE LOST WORLD, by Michael Crichton. (Knopf, $25.95.) Scientists visit a Costa
Rican jungle that is the breeding ground of dinosaurs; a sequel to "Jurassic Park."
THE CHRISTMAS BOX, by Richard Paul Evans. (Simon & Schuster, $12.95.)
When a young family moves in with a widow, they all learn about the significance
of Christmas.
SILENT NIGHT, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Simon & Schuster, $16.) A family finds
adversity and renewed courage during a Christmastime visit to New York.
THE CHILDREN'S BOOK OF VIRTUES, edited by William J. Bennett. Illustrated
by Michael Hague. (Simon & Schuster, $20.) Stories and poems.
THE HUNDRED SECRET SENSES, by Amy Tan. (Putnam, $24.95.) The
changing relationship between a Chinese-American woman and her older Chinese
half sister.
THE HORSE WHISPERER, by Nicholas Evans. (Delacorte, $23.95.) A troubled
woman seeks solace for herself, her daughter and their horse from a wrangler in
Montana.
POLITICALLY CORRECT HOLIDAY STORIES, by James Finn Garner.
(Macmillan, $9.95.) Five classic Christmas stories retold to avoid offending current
sensibilities.
MORNING, NOON, AND NIGHT, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $24.) The
mysterious drowning of a respected tycoon leads to the revelation of a tangle of
scandals.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
LOVE ME FOREVER, by Johanna Lindsey. (Morrow, $22.) Matchmaking for
money and for love among noble families in 19th-century England and Scotland.
COMING HOME, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (Dunne/St. Martin's, $25.95.) A British
woman comes of age during World War II.
A CUP OF CHRISTMAS TEA, by Tom Hegg. (Waldman House, $10.95.) A book
of verses, illustrated by Warren Hanson.
PUERTO VALLARTA SQUEEZE, by Robert James Waller. (Warner, $18.95.) An
American writer living in Mexico is hired by a murderer to help him escape to
Texas.
December 3, 1995
Non-Fiction
MISS AMERICA, by Howard Stern. (Regan Books, $27.50.) Anecdotes and
fulminations from the radio talk show host.
MY AMERICAN JOURNEY, by Colin L. Powell with Joseph E. Persico. (Random
House, $25.95.) The autobiography of the former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of
Staff.
CHARLES KURALT'S AMERICA, by Charles Kuralt. (Putnam, $24.95.) From
Alaska to Florida: the most recent travels of the itinerant television reporter.
EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE, by Daniel Goleman. (Bantam, $23.95.) Factors
other than I.Q. that contribute to a successful and happy life.
MY POINT ... AND I DO HAVE ONE, by Ellen DeGeneres. (Bantam, $19.95.)
Observations on life and the pursuit of happiness by the television star and stand-
up comedian.
DAVID BRINKLEY, by David Brinkley. (Knopf, $25.) From a boyhood in North
Carolina through five decades as a television newscaster: a memoir.
LINCOLN, by David Herbert Donald. (Simon & Schuster, $35.) The life of the 16th
President.
SISTERS. Essays by Carol Saline. Photographs by Sharon J. Wohlmuth.
(Running Press, $27.50.) The relationships of 36 sets of sisters of varied callings
and backgrounds.
DAYS OF OUR LIVES, by Lorraine Zenka. (Regan Books/HarperCollins, $25.) An
album of facts and pictures celebrating the television show's first 30 years.
MINDHUNTER, by John Douglas and Mark Olshaker. (Drew/Scribner, $24.) The
memoirs of the former leader of an F.B.I. team charged with studying the behavior
of serial killers and assassins.
RETURN WITH HONOR, by Scott O'Grady with Jeff Coplon. (Doubleday, $21.95.)
The ordeal of a United States fighter pilot shot down over Bosnia in June.
A GOOD WALK SPOILED, by John Feinstein. (Little, Brown, $23.95.) A
sportswriter reports on the P.G.A. Tour in 1993 and 1994.
A SIMPLE PATH, by Mother Teresa. Compiled by Lucinda Vardey. (Ballantine,
$20.) The thoughts, experiences and beliefs of the Nobel Prize-winning nun.
MY LIFE IN HIGH HEELS, by Loni Anderson with Larkin Warren. (Morrow, $23.)
The memoirs of the television actress.
AMAZING GRACE, by Jonathan Kozol. (Crown, $23.) Life as experienced by
